CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: When considering that PIDT-C12NT shows higher hole mobility and superior absorption to that of PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT , it is rational to envisage that PIDT-C12NT would achieve superior processability and backbone planarity among three polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the given paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| PIDT-DTNT |

Paragraph: When considering that PIDT-C12NT shows higher hole mobility and superior absorption to that of PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT , it is rational to envisage that PIDT-C12NT would achieve superior processability and backbone planarity among three polymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobility |
| absorption |
| processability |
| backbone planarity |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobility |
| absorption |
| backbone planarity |

The following entities do not clearly refer to material properties:

* "processability" (this refers to the ability of a material to be processed or manufactured, not a property of the material itself)

Therefore, the valid entities that refer to material properties in the given paragraph are:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobility |
| absorption |
| backbone planarity |
